result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Peltier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: I/S Sentence  6 months  Jail will allow Electronic monitor if eligible - stayed

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescriptions.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Early discharge if recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
9:25 a.m. Defendant Andrew J. Peltier in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. I/S sentence w/conditions
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield concurs with joint agreement.  

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION**
I/S Sentence  6 months  Jail will allow Electronic monitor if eligible - stayed (2 days credit)
Probation: 
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescriptions.
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Early discharge if recommended by Agent.
Pay Court costs + DNA surcharges.
Provide DNA sample.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 29, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Andrew J. Peltier in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:26 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT:
Bound over for trial in Branch 3.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADA Knappen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knappen states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  1-11-2016  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
